Class Humanoid

java.lang.Object
Humanoid
Direct Known Subclasses:
Elves, Hobbits, Humans
public class Humanoid
extends java.lang.Object
This model class will be our Top Class for Humanoids and will let us create characters of Elves, Hobbits, and Humans. This will be inherited by Class Elves, Hobbits, and Humans.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Humanoid​(java.lang.String name)
    Constructor that only takes in 1 parameter, which is name
    Humanoid​(java.lang.String name, int strength, int dexterity, int armour, int moxie, int coins, int health)
    Constructor that takes in 7 parameters with random values except for the name

  • Constructor Details

    • Humanoid

      public Humanoid​(java.lang.String name)
      Constructor that only takes in 1 parameter, which is name
      Parameters:
      name - Humanoid's Name

    • Humanoid

      public Humanoid​(java.lang.String name, int strength, int dexterity, int armour, int moxie, int coins, int health)
      Constructor that takes in 7 parameters with random values except for the name
      Parameters:
      name - Humanoid's Name
      strength - Humanoid's Random Strength value from 1-20
      dexterity - Humanoid's Random Dexterity value from 1-20
      armour - Humanoid's Random Armour value from 1-20
      moxie - Humanoid's Random Moxie value from 1-20
      coins - Humanoid's Random Coins value from 1-100
      health - Humanoid's Random Health value from 1-100

    • attack

      public void attack​(Humanoid target)
      Method that deals damage to a Humanoid based on the average of our Strength, Dexterity, and Health then divide it with the armour of the chosen target. If the target has 0 armour, we make it 1 so we can divide. If our health is 0, we cannot attack.
      Parameters:
      target - Humanoid we want to attack.

    • healthStatus

      public java.lang.String healthStatus()
      Method that tells us if a Humanoid is "ALIVE" or "DEAD" based on their health
      Returns:
      health status of the Humanoid based on their health

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the Humanoids
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String representation of the Humanoids
